title: Jack Nicholson Creeps Out Of Retirement To Star In ‘Toni Erdmann' | moviepilot.com
text:
Why Jack Nicholson Is Perfect For The Role Of Toni Erdmann Toni Erdmann [Credit: NFP Marketing & Distribution] / About Schmidt [Credit: New Line Cinema] 
Once news was released through Variety that Jack Nicholson was attached to play the role of Toni Erdmann, those who had seen the original German movie could understand why the Shining star was such a perfect match for the role. Here's why: Toni Erdmann is by nature a lovable prankster whose sense of humour shines through above all else. Essentially — his personality mirrors that of Jack Nicholson. The visual similarities are quite frankly, uncanny (see above). While Toni Erdmann is a joker, he also has a heart of gold and is desperate to connect with his corporate daughter, similarly, for all his roguishness, Jack has a good heart beneath the layers of prankster behavior. Why Kristen Wiig Is Perfect For The Role Of Toni Erdmann's Daughter Toni Erdmann [Credit: NFP Marketing & Distribution] / Hateship Loveship [Credit: Benaroya Pictures] 
Similarly, with Jack Nicholson's name attached, Kristen Wiig stepping in to play Toni Erdmann's estranged, corporate daughter Ines Conradi seems like another inspired piece of casting: Both Ines and Kristen have a subtle darkness and vulnerability to their characters which is essential to the role. However, beneath the cold, corporate exterior lies a hidden sense of humor which makes a rather dramatic appearance in the movie — something which Kristen will absolutely excel at. Like Sandra Hüller who plays Ines, Wiig is a recognizable name, but she's not a super A-list star, which allows her to play more fringe, exciting roles such as Toni Erdmann's daughter. Poll Will you go to see the American remake of Toni Erdmann? Yes, the cast looks amazing! Erm, no. I am able to read subtitles so will stick with the original thanks.
